name: ALLOW_HIDING_DISCUSSION_TAB
description_a: If True, it adds an option to show/hide the discussions tab.

name: BADGR_ENABLE_NOTIFICATIONS
description_a:
Optional setting for enabling email notifications. When set to "True",
    learners will be notified by email when they earn a badge.
warning_a: Review FEATURES['ENABLE_OPENBADGES'] for further context.

name: BLOCK_STRUCTURES_SETTINGS['PRUNING_ACTIVE']
description_a:
When `True`, only a specified number of versions of block structure
   files are kept for each structure, and the rest are cleaned up. The number of versions that
   are kept can be specified in the `BlockStructureConfiguration`, which can be edited in
   Django Admin. The default number of versions that are kept is `5`.
warning_a: This toggle will likely be deprecated and removed.

name: BULK_EMAIL_SEND_USING_EDX_ACE
description_a: If True, use edx-ace to send bulk email messages

name: COOKIE_NAME_CHANGE_ACTIVATE
description_a: Used to enable CookieNameChange middleware which changes a cookie name in request.COOKIES
warning_a: This should be set at the same time you set COOKIE_NAME_CHANGE_EXPAND_INFO setting

name: COURSEGRAPH_DUMP_COURSE_ON_PUBLISH
description_a:
Whether, upon publish, a course should automatically
      be exported to Neo4j via the connection parameters specified in
      `COURSEGRAPH_CONNECTION`.

name: COURSES_INVITE_ONLY
description_a: Setting this sets the default value of INVITE_ONLY across all courses in a given deployment

name: CUSTOM_COURSES_EDX
description_a:
Set to True to enable Custom Courses for edX, a feature that is more commonly known as
   CCX. Documentation for configuring and using this feature is available at
   https://edx.readthedocs.io/projects/open-edx-ca/en/latest/set_up_course/custom_courses.html
warning_a:
When set to true, 'lms.djangoapps.ccx.overrides.CustomCoursesForEdxOverrideProvider' will
    be added to MODULESTORE_FIELD_OVERRIDE_PROVIDERS

name: CourseDurationLimitConfig.enabled
description_a:
When enabled, users will have a limited time to complete and audit the course. The exact
       duration is given by the "weeks_to_complete" course detail. When enabled, it is necessary to also define the
       "enabled_as_of" flag: only enrollments created after this date will be affected.

name: CourseHLSPlaybackEnabledFlag.course_id
description_a: Add the "hls" profile to all displayed videos for a single course.

name: CourseVideoUploadsEnabledByDefault.course_id
description_a:
Allow video uploads for a specific course. This enables the
      "Video Uploads" menu in the CMS.

name: DEFAULT_MOBILE_AVAILABLE
description_a:
This specifies if the courses are available for mobile by default. To make any individual
   course available for mobile one can set the value of Mobile Course Available to true in Advanced Settings from the
   studio when this is False.

name: DISABLE_DEPRECATED_SIGNIN_URL
description_a: Toggle for removing the deprecated /signin url.
warning_a: This url can be removed once it no longer has any real traffic.

name: DISABLE_DEPRECATED_SIGNUP_URL
description_a: Toggle for removing the deprecated /signup url.
warning_a: This url can be removed once it no longer has any real traffic.

name: DISABLE_JWT_FOR_MOBILE
description_a:
Set toggle to True to ignore mobile requests
   for JWTs, and instead provide the legacy opaque Bearer token. This
   toggle can be used as a temporary kill switch as the mobile app
   attempts to rollout the transition to JWT authentication for the
   first time.

name: ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_BLOCK_HIBP_POLICY
description_a:
When enabled, this toggle activates the use of the password validation
   on Authn MFE's login.

name: ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_NUDGE_HIBP_POLICY
description_a:
When enabled, this toggle activates the use of the password validation
   on Authn MFE's login.

name: ENABLE_AUTHN_REGISTER_HIBP_POLICY
description_a:
When enabled, this toggle activates the use of the password validation
   HIBP Policy on Authn MFE's registration.

name: ENABLE_AUTHN_RESET_PASSWORD_HIBP_POLICY
description_a:
When enabled, this toggle activates the use of the password validation
   HIBP Policy.

name: ENABLE_CODEJAIL_REST_SERVICE
description_a:
Set this to True if you want to run Codejail code using
   a separate VM or container and communicate with edx-platform using REST API.

name: ENABLE_COMPREHENSIVE_THEMING
description_a:
When enabled, this toggle activates the use of the custom theme
   defined by DEFAULT_SITE_THEME.

name: ENABLE_COPPA_COMPLIANCE
description_a: When True, inforces COPPA compliance and removes YOB field from registration form and accounnt

name: ENABLE_DYNAMIC_REGISTRATION_FIELDS
description_a: When enabled, this toggle adds fields configured in

name: ENABLE_MFE_CONFIG_API
description_a:
Set to True to enable MFE Config API. This is disabled by
   default.

name: ENABLE_REQUIRE_THIRD_PARTY_AUTH
description_a:
Set to True to prevent using username/password login and registration and only allow
   authentication with third party auth
warning_a: Requires configuration of third party auth

name: ENFORCE_SAFE_SESSIONS
description_a:
Invalidate session and response if mismatch detected.
   That is, when the `user` attribute of the request object gets changed or
   no longer matches the session, the session will be invalidated and the
   response cancelled (changed to an error). This is intended as a backup
   safety measure in case an attacker (or bug) is able to change the user
   on a session in an unexpected way.
warning_a:
Should be disabled if debugging mismatches using the
   LOG_REQUEST_USER_CHANGE_HEADERS toggle, otherwise series of mismatching
   requests from the same user cannot be investigated.  Additionally, if
   enabling for the first time, confirm that incidences of the string
   "SafeCookieData user at request" in the logs are very rare; if they are
   not, it is likely that there is either a bug or that a login or
   registration endpoint needs to call ``mark_user_change_as_expected``.

name: EXPECTED_ERRORS[N]['IS_IGNORED']
description_a:
Set this to False if the errors are not ignored by monitoring, but only expected, like
      for temporary problems that may take some time to fix. If True, adds the custom attributes
      ``error_ignored_class`` and ``error_ignored_message`` to help diagnose issues with ignored errors, since
      this data is not otherwise available. For example of ignoring errors in New Relic, see:
      https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/agents/manage-apm-agents/agent-data/manage-errors-apm-collect-ignore-or-mark-expected/#ignore  pylint: disable=line-too-long,useless-suppression
      To query for ignored errors, you would use ``error_ignored_class IS NOT NULL``.
      Note: This is defaulted to True because it will be easier for us to detect if True is not the correct value, by
      seeing that these errors aren't actually ignored.
warning_a:
At this time, this toggle does not actually configure the error to be ignored. It is meant to match
     the ignored error configuration found elsewhere. When monitoring, no errors should ever have the attribute
     ``error_ignored_class``. Only Transactions should have this custom attribute. If found for an error, it means we
     are stating an error should be ignored when it is not actually configured as such, or the configuration is not
     working.

name: EXPECTED_ERRORS[N]['LOG_ERROR']
description_a: If True, the error will be logged with a message like: "Expected error ...".

name: EXPECTED_ERRORS[N]['LOG_STACK_TRACE']
description_a: If True, the stacktrace will be included with the logging message.
warning_a: Requires ``LOG_ERROR`` to be set to True, otherwise this value will be ignored.

name: FEATURES['ALLOW_ADMIN_ENTERPRISE_COURSE_ENROLLMENT_DELETION']
description_a: If true, allows for the deletion of EnterpriseCourseEnrollment records via Django Admin.

name: FEATURES['ALLOW_AUTOMATED_SIGNUPS']
description_a:
Enable to show a section in the membership tab of the instructor
   dashboard to allow an upload of a CSV file that contains a list of new accounts to create
   and register for course.

name: FEATURES['ALLOW_COURSE_RERUNS']
description_a:
This will allow staff member to re-run the course from the studio home page and will
   always use the split modulestore. When this is set to False, the Re-run Course link will not be available on
   the studio home page.

name: FEATURES['ALLOW_COURSE_STAFF_GRADE_DOWNLOADS']
description_a:
Enable to give course staff unrestricted access to grade downloads;
   if set to False, only edX superusers can perform the downloads.

name: FEATURES['ALLOW_EMAIL_ADDRESS_CHANGE']
description_a:
Allow users to change their email address on the Account Settings page. If this is
   disabled, users will not be able to change their email address.

name: FEATURES['ALLOW_PUBLIC_ACCOUNT_CREATION']
description_a:
Allow public account creation. If this is disabled, users will no longer have access to
   the signup page.

name: FEATURES['ALWAYS_REDIRECT_HOMEPAGE_TO_DASHBOARD_FOR_AUTHENTICATED_USER']
description_a:
When a logged in user goes to the homepage ('/') the user will be redirected to the
   dashboard page when this flag is set to True - this is default Open edX behavior. Set to False to not redirect
   the user.

name: FEATURES['AUTOMATIC_AUTH_FOR_TESTING']
description_a:
Set to True to perform acceptance and load test. Auto auth view is responsible for load
   testing and is controlled by this feature flag. Auto-auth causes issues in Bok Choy tests because it resets the
   requesting user. Session verification (of CacheBackedAuthenticationMiddleware) is a security feature, but it
   can be turned off by enabling this feature flag.
warning_a: If this has been set to True then the account activation email will be skipped.

name: FEATURES['AUTOMATIC_VERIFY_STUDENT_IDENTITY_FOR_TESTING']
description_a:
If set to True, then we want to skip posting anything to Software Secure. Bypass posting
   anything to Software Secure if the auto verify feature for testing is enabled. We actually don't even create
   the message because that would require encryption and message signing that rely on settings.VERIFY_STUDENT
   values that aren't set in dev. So we just pretend like we successfully posted and automatically approve student
   identity verification attempts.

name: FEATURES['BATCH_ENROLLMENT_NOTIFY_USERS_DEFAULT']
description_a:
Controls if the "Notify users by email" checkbox in the batch
   enrollment form on the instructor dashboard is already checked on page load or not.

name: FEATURES['CERTIFICATES_HTML_VIEW']
description_a: Set to True to enable course certificates on your instance of Open edX.
warning_a:
You must enable this feature flag in both Studio and the LMS and complete the configuration tasks
   described here:
   https://edx.readthedocs.io/projects/edx-installing-configuring-and-running/en/latest/configuration/enable_certificates.html  pylint: disable=line-too-long,useless-suppression

name: FEATURES['CERTIFICATES_INSTRUCTOR_GENERATION']  # lint-amnesty, pylint: disable=annotation-missing-token
description_a:
Enable to allow batch generation of certificates from the instructor dashboard.
   In case of self-paced courses, the certificate generation button is hidden if certificate
   generation is not explicitly enabled globally or for the specific course.

name: FEATURES['COURSES_ARE_BROWSABLE']
description_a:
When this is set to True, all the courses will be listed on the /courses page and Explore
   Courses link will be visible. Set to False if courses list and Explore Courses link need to be hidden.
warning_a: This Effects views and templates.

name: FEATURES['CUSTOM_CERTIFICATE_TEMPLATES_ENABLED']
description_a: Set to True to enable custom certificate templates which are configured via Django admin.
warning_a: None

name: FEATURES['DEPRECATE_OLD_COURSE_KEYS_IN_STUDIO']
description_a:
Warn about removing support for deprecated course keys.
      To enable, set to True.
      To disable, set to False.
      To enable with a custom support deadline, set to an ISO-8601 date string:
        eg: '2020-09-01'
warning_a:
This can be removed once support is removed for deprecated
   course keys.

name: FEATURES['DISABLE_ALLOWED_ENROLLMENT_IF_ENROLLMENT_CLOSED']
description_a: Set to True to disable enrollment for user invited to a course

name: FEATURES['DISABLE_COURSE_CREATION']
description_a:
If set to True, it disables the course creation functionality and hides the "New Course"
   button in studio.
   It is important to note that the value of this flag only affects if the user doesn't have a staff role,
   otherwise the course creation functionality will work as it should.
warning_a: Another toggle DISABLE_LIBRARY_CREATION overrides DISABLE_COURSE_CREATION, if present.

name: FEATURES['DISABLE_HONOR_CERTIFICATES']
description_a:
Set to True to disable honor certificates. Typically used when your installation only
   allows verified certificates, like courses.edx.org.

name: FEATURES['DISABLE_LOGIN_BUTTON']
description_a:
Removes the display of the login button in the navigation bar.
   Change is only at the UI level. Used in systems where login is automatic, eg MIT SSL

name: FEATURES['DISABLE_MOBILE_COURSE_AVAILABLE']
description_a:
Set to True to remove Mobile Course Available UI Flag from Studio's Advanced Settings
   page else Mobile Course Available UI Flag will be available on Studio side.

name: FEATURES['DISABLE_START_DATES']
description_a:
When True, all courses will be active, regardless of start
   date.
warning_a: This will cause ALL courses to be immediately visible.

name: FEATURES['DISABLE_UNENROLLMENT']
description_a:
Set to True to disable self-unenrollments via REST API.
   This also hides the "Unenroll" button on the Learner Dashboard.
warning_a:
For consistency in user experience, keep the value in sync with the setting of the same name
   in the LMS and CMS.

name: FEATURES['DISPLAY_ANALYTICS_ENROLLMENTS']
description_a:
Enable display of enrollment counts in instructor dashboard and
   analytics section.

name: FEATURES['DISPLAY_DEBUG_INFO_TO_STAFF']
description_a:
Add a "Staff Debug" button to course modules for debugging
   by course staff.

name: FEATURES['DISPLAY_HISTOGRAMS_TO_STAFF']
description_a: This displays histograms in the Staff Debug Info panel to course staff.
warning_a:
Generating histograms requires scanning the courseware_studentmodule table on each view. This
   can make staff access to courseware very slow on large courses.

name: FEATURES['EDITABLE_SHORT_DESCRIPTION']
description_a:
This feature flag allows editing of short descriptions on the Schedule & Details page in
   Open edX Studio. Set to False if you want to disable the editing of the course short description.

name: FEATURES['EMBARGO']
description_a:
Turns on embargo functionality, which blocks users from
   the site or courses based on their location. Embargo can restrict users by states
   and whitelist/blacklist (IP Addresses (ie. 10.0.0.0), Networks (ie. 10.0.0.0/24)), or the user profile country.
warning_a:
reverse proxy should be configured appropriately for example Client IP address headers
   (e.g HTTP_X_FORWARDED_FOR) should be configured.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_ACCOUNT_DELETION']
description_a:
Whether to display the account deletion section on Account Settings page. Set to False to
   hide this section.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_ANNOUNCEMENTS']
description_a:
This feature can be enabled to show system wide announcements
       on the sidebar of the learner dashboard. Announcements can be created by Global Staff
       users on maintenance dashboard of studio. Maintenance dashboard can accessed at
       https://{studio.domain}/maintenance
warning_a: TinyMCE is needed to show an editor in the studio.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_AUTHN_MICROFRONTEND']
description_a: Supports staged rollout of a new micro-frontend-based implementation of the logistration.
warning_a:
Also set settings.AUTHN_MICROFRONTEND_URL for rollout. This temporary feature
   toggle does not have a target removal date.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_AUTOMATED_SIGNUPS_EXTRA_FIELDS']
description_a:
When True, the CSV file that contains a list of
   new accounts to create and register for a course in the membership
   tab of the instructor dashboard will accept the cohort name to
   assign the new user and the enrollment course mode.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_BULK_ENROLLMENT_VIEW']
description_a:
When set to True the bulk enrollment view is enabled and one can use it to enroll multiple
   users in a course using bulk enrollment API endpoint (/api/bulk_enroll/v1/bulk_enroll).

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_BULK_USER_RETIREMENT']
description_a:
Set to True to enable bulk user retirement through REST API. This is disabled by
   default.
warning_a: None

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_CCX_ANALYTICS_DASHBOARD_URL']
description_a:
Display the 'Analytics' tab in the instructor dashboard for CCX courses.
   Note: This has no effect unless ANALYTICS_DASHBOARD_URL is already set, because without that
   setting, the tab does not show up for any courses.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_CERTIFICATES_IDV_REQUIREMENT']
description_a: Whether to enforce ID Verification requirements for couse certificates generation

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_CHANGE_USER_PASSWORD_ADMIN']
description_a:
Set to True to enable changing a user password through django admin. This is disabled by
   default because enabling allows a method to bypass password policy.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_COMBINED_LOGIN_REGISTRATION_FOOTER']
description_a:
Display the standard footer in the login page. This feature can be overridden by a site-
   specific configuration.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_CONTENT_LIBRARIES_LTI_TOOL']
description_a:
When set to True, Content Libraries in
    Studio can be used as an LTI 1.3 tool by external LTI platforms.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_COOKIE_CONSENT']
description_a:
Enable header banner for cookie consent using this service:
   https://cookieconsent.insites.com/

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_COSMETIC_DISPLAY_PRICE']
description_a:
Enable the display of "cosmetic_display_price", set in a course advanced settings. This
   cosmetic price is used when there is no registration price associated to the course.
warning_a: The use case of this feature toggle is uncertain.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_COURSEWARE_SEARCH']
description_a:
When enabled, this adds a Search the course widget on the course outline and courseware
   pages for searching courseware data.
warning_a:
In order to get this working, your courses data should be indexed in Elasticsearch. You will
   see the search widget on the courseware page only if the DISABLE_COURSE_OUTLINE_PAGE_FLAG is set.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_COURSEWARE_SEARCH_FOR_COURSE_STAFF']
description_a:
When enabled, this adds a Search the course widget on the course outline and courseware
   pages for searching courseware data but for course staff users only.
warning_a:
In order to get this working, your courses data should be indexed in Elasticsearch. If
   ENABLE_COURSEWARE_SEARCH is enabled then the search widget will be visible to all learners and this flag's
   value does not matter in that case. This flag is enabled in devstack by default.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_COURSE_ASSESSMENT_GRADE_CHANGE_SIGNAL']
description_a:
Set to True to start sending signals for assessment level grade updates. Notably, the only
   handler of this signal at the time of this writing sends assessment updates to enterprise integrated channels.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_COURSE_DISCOVERY']
description_a:
Add a course search widget to the LMS for searching courses. When this is enabled, the
   latest courses are no longer displayed on the LMS landing page. Also, an "Explore Courses" item is added to the
   navbar.
warning_a: The COURSE_DISCOVERY_MEANINGS setting should be properly defined.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_COURSE_FILENAME_CCX_SUFFIX']
description_a: If set to True, CCX ID will be included in the generated filename for CCX courses.
warning_a: Turning this feature ON will affect all generated filenames which are related to CCX courses.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_COURSE_HOME_REDIRECT']
description_a:
When enabled, along with the ENABLE_MKTG_SITE feature toggle, users who attempt to access a
   course "about" page will be redirected to the course home url.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_COURSE_SORTING_BY_START_DATE']
description_a:
When a user goes to the homepage ('/') the user sees the courses listed in the
   announcement dates order - this is default Open edX behavior. Set to True to change the course sorting behavior
   by their start dates, latest first.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_CREDIT_ELIGIBILITY']
description_a:
When enabled, it is possible to define a credit eligibility criteria in the CMS. A "Credit
   Eligibility" section then appears for those courses in the LMS.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_CSMH_EXTENDED']
description_a:
Write Courseware Student Module History (CSMH) to the extended table: this logs all
   student activities to MySQL, in a separate database.
warning_a:
Even though most Open edX instances run with a separate CSMH database, it may not always be
   the case. When disabling this feature flag, remember to remove "lms.djangoapps.coursewarehistoryextended"
   from the INSTALLED_APPS and the "StudentModuleHistoryExtendedRouter" from the DATABASE_ROUTERS.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_DASHBOARD_SEARCH']
description_a:
When enabled, this adds a Search Your Courses widget on the dashboard page for searching
   courseware data.
warning_a: In order to get this working, your courses data should be indexed in Elasticsearch.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_DISCUSSION_EMAIL_DIGEST']
description_a:
Set this to True if you want the discussion digest emails
   enabled automatically for new users. This will be set on all new account
   registrations.
warning_a:
It is not recommended to enable this feature if ENABLE_DISCUSSION_HOME_PANEL is not enabled,
   since subscribers who receive digests in that case will only be able to unsubscribe via links embedded in
   their emails, and they will have no way to resubscribe.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_DISCUSSION_HOME_PANEL']
description_a:
Hides or displays a welcome panel under the Discussion tab, which includes a subscription
   on/off setting for discussion digest emails.
warning_a: This should remain off in production until digest notifications are online.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_DISCUSSION_SERVICE']
description_a:
When True, it will enable the Discussion tab in courseware for all courses. Setting this
   to False will not contain inline discussion components and discussion tab in any courses.
warning_a:
If the discussion panel is present in the course and the value for this flag is False then,
   attempting to expand those components will cause errors. So, this should only be set to False with an LMS that
   is running courses that do not contain discussion components.
   For consistency in user-experience, keep the value in sync with the setting of the same name in the CMS.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_DJANGO_ADMIN_SITE']
description_a: Set to False if you want to disable Django's admin site.
warning_a: It is not recommended to disable this feature as there are many settings available on

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_EDXNOTES']
description_a:
This toggle enables the students to save and manage their annotations in the
   course using the notes service. The bulk of the actual work in storing the notes is done by
   a separate service (see the edx-notes-api repo).
warning_a:
Requires the edx-notes-api service properly running and to have configured the django settings
   EDXNOTES_INTERNAL_API and EDXNOTES_PUBLIC_API. If you update this setting, also update it in Studio.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_EXAM_SETTINGS_HTML_VIEW']
description_a: When enabled, users can access the new course authoring view for proctoring exams
warning_a: None

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_EXPORT_GIT']
description_a:
When enabled, a "Export to Git" menu item is added to the course studio for courses that have a
   valid "giturl" attribute. Exporting a course to git causes the course to be exported in the directory indicated by
   the GIT_REPO_EXPORT_DIR setting. Note that when this feature is disabled, courses can still be exported to git with
   the git_export management command.
warning_a:
To enable this feature, the GIT_REPO_EXPORT_DIR setting must be properly defined and point to an
   existing directory.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_FOOTER_MOBILE_APP_LINKS']
description_a:
Set to True if you want show the mobile app links (Apple App Store & Google Play Store) in
   the footer.
warning_a:
If you set this to True then you should also set your mobile application's app store and play
   store URLs in the MOBILE_STORE_URLS settings dictionary. These links are not part of the default theme. If you
   want these links on your footer then you should use the edx.org theme.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_FORUM_DAILY_DIGEST']
description_a:
Settings for forums/discussions to on/off daily digest
   feature. Set this to True if you want to enable users to subscribe and unsubscribe
   for daily digest. This setting enables deprecation of daily digest.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_GRADE_DOWNLOADS']
description_a:
Enable grade CSV downloads from the instructor dashboard. Grade
   calculation started from the instructor dashboard will write grades CSV files to the
   configured storage backend and give links for downloads.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_HELP_LINK']
description_a: When True, a help link is displayed on the main navbar. Set False to hide it.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_HTML_XBLOCK_STUDENT_VIEW_DATA']
description_a:
Whether HTML Block returns HTML content with the Course Blocks API when the API
   is called with student_view_data=html query parameter.
warning_a:
Because the Course Blocks API caches its data, the cache must be cleared (e.g. by
   re-publishing the course) for changes to this flag to take effect.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_INTEGRITY_SIGNATURE']
description_a: Whether to display honor code agreement for learners before their first grade assignment

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_LEARNER_RECORDS']
description_a:
Enable learner records for the whole platform. This setting may be overridden by site- and
   org-specific site configurations with the same name.
warning_a:
Enabling this feature requires that the definition of the ``CREDENTIALS_PUBLIC_SERVICE_URL``
   setting.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_LIBRARY_AUTHORING_MICROFRONTEND']
description_a: Set to True to enable the Library Authoring MFE
warning_a:
Also set settings.LIBRARY_AUTHORING_MICROFRONTEND_URL and see
   REDIRECT_TO_LIBRARY_AUTHORING_MICROFRONTEND for rollout.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_LOGIN_MICROFRONTEND']
description_a: Enable the login micro frontend.
warning_a: The login MFE domain name should be listed in LOGIN_REDIRECT_WHITELIST.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_LTI_PROVIDER']
description_a:
When set to True, Open edX site can be used as an LTI Provider to other systems
    and applications.
warning_a:
After enabling this feature flag there are multiple steps invloved to configure edX
    as LTI provider. Full guide is available here:
    https://edx.readthedocs.io/projects/edx-installing-configuring-and-running/en/latest/configuration/lti/index.html

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_MASQUERADE']
description_a: None

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_MAX_FAILED_LOGIN_ATTEMPTS']
description_a:
This feature will keep track of the number of failed login attempts on a given user's
   email. If the number of consecutive failed login attempts - without a successful login at some point - reaches
   a configurable threshold (default 6), then the account will be locked for a configurable amount of seconds
   (30 minutes) which will prevent additional login attempts until this time period has passed. If a user
   successfully logs in, all the counter which tracks the number of failed attempts will be reset back to 0. If
   set to False then account locking will be disabled for failed login attempts.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_MKTG_SITE']
description_a: Toggle to enable alternate urls for marketing links.
warning_a:
When this is enabled, the MKTG_URLS setting should be defined. The use case of this feature
   toggle is uncertain.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_NEW_BULK_EMAIL_EXPERIENCE']
description_a:
When true, replaces the bulk email tool found on the
   instructor dashboard with a link to the new communications MFE version instead.
   Stting the tool to false will leave the old bulk email tool experience in place.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_OAUTH2_PROVIDER']
description_a:
Enable this feature to allow this Open edX platform to be an OAuth2 authentication
   provider. This is necessary to enable some other features, such as the REST API for the mobile application.
warning_a: This temporary feature toggle does not have a target removal date.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_OPENBADGES']
description_a: Enables support for the creation of OpenBadges as a method of awarding credentials.
warning_a:
The following settings (all of which are in the same file) should be set or reviewed prior to
    enabling this setting: BADGING_BACKEND, BADGR_API_TOKEN, BADGR_BASE_URL, BADGR_ISSUER_SLUG, BADGR_TIMEOUT.
    Full guide for setting up OpenBadges available here:
    https://edx.readthedocs.io/projects/edx-installing-configuring-and-running/en/latest/configuration/enable_badging.html  pylint: disable=line-too-long,useless-suppression

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_ORA_ALL_FILE_URLS']
description_a:
A "work-around" feature toggle meant to help in cases where some file uploads are not
   discoverable.  If enabled, will iterate through all possible file key suffixes up to the max for displaying
   file metadata in staff assessments.
warning_a: This temporary feature toggle does not have a target removal date.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_ORA_TEAM_SUBMISSIONS']
description_a: Set to True to enable team-based ORA submissions.
warning_a:
This temporary feature toggle does not have a target removal date. This can be overridden by a
      course waffle flags or a waffle switch with identical name.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_ORA_USERNAMES_ON_DATA_EXPORT']
description_a:
Set to True to add deanonymized usernames to ORA data
   report.
warning_a: This temporary feature toggle does not have a target removal date.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_ORA_USER_STATE_UPLOAD_DATA']
description_a:
A "work-around" feature toggle meant to help in cases where some file uploads are not
   discoverable.  If enabled, will pull file metadata from StudentModule.state for display in staff assessments.
warning_a: This temporary feature toggle does not have a target removal date.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_PASSWORD_RESET_FAILURE_EMAIL']
description_a:
Whether to send an email for failed password reset attempts or not. This happens when a
   user asks for a password reset but they don't have an account associated to their email. This is useful for
   notifying users that they don't have an account associated with email addresses they believe they've registered
   with. This setting can be overridden by a site-specific configuration.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_SPECIAL_EXAMS']
description_a: Enable to use special exams, aka timed and proctored exams.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_STUDENT_HISTORY_VIEW']
description_a:
This provides a UI to show a student's submission history in a problem by the Staff Debug
   tool. Set to False if you want to hide Submission History from the courseware page.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_TEXTBOOK']
description_a: Add PDF and HTML textbook tabs to the courseware.
warning_a:
For consistency in user-experience, keep the value in sync with the setting of the same name
   in the CMS.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_AUTH']
description_a:
Turn on third-party auth. Disabled for now because full mplementations are not yet
   available. Remember to run migrations if you enable this; we don't create tables by default. This feature can
   be enabled on a per-site basis. When enabling this feature, remember to define the allowed authentication
   backends with the AUTHENTICATION_BACKENDS setting.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_UNICODE_USERNAME']
description_a:
Set this to True to allow unicode characters in username. Enabling this will also
   automatically enable SOCIAL_AUTH_CLEAN_USERNAMES. When this is enabled, usernames will have to match the
   regular expression defined by USERNAME_REGEX_PARTIAL.

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_V2_CERT_DISPLAY_SETTINGS']
description_a: Whether to use the reimagined certificates_display_behavior and certificate_available_date

name: FEATURES['ENABLE_XBLOCK_VIEW_ENDPOINT']
description_a:
Enable an API endpoint, named "xblock_view", to serve rendered XBlock views. This might be
   used by external applications. See for instance jquery-xblock (now unmaintained):
   https://github.com/openedx/jquery-xblock

name: FEATURES['ENTRANCE_EXAMS']
description_a:
Enable entrance exams feature. When enabled, students see an exam xblock as the first unit
   of the course.

name: FEATURES['HIDE_DASHBOARD_COURSES_UNTIL_ACTIVATED']
description_a:
When set, it hides the Courses list on the Learner Dashboard page if the learner has not
   yet activated the account and not enrolled in any courses.

name: FEATURES['LICENSING']
description_a:
Toggle platform-wide course licensing. The course.license attribute is then used to append
   license information to the courseware.

name: FEATURES['MILESTONES_APP']
description_a:
Enable the milestones application, which manages significant Course and/or Student events in
   the Open edX platform. (see https://github.com/openedx/edx-milestones) Note that this feature is required to enable
   course pre-requisites.

name: FEATURES['RESTRICT_AUTOMATIC_AUTH']
description_a:
Prevent auto auth from creating superusers or modifying existing users. Auto auth is a
   mechanism where superusers can simply modify attributes of other users by accessing the "/auto_auth url" with
   the right
   querystring parameters.

name: FEATURES['SHOW_FOOTER_LANGUAGE_SELECTOR']
description_a: When set to True, language selector will be visible in the footer.
warning_a: LANGUAGE_COOKIE_NAME is required to use footer-language-selector, set it if it has not been set.

name: FEATURES['SHOW_HEADER_LANGUAGE_SELECTOR']
description_a: When set to True, language selector will be visible in the header.
warning_a:
You should set the languages in the DarkLangConfig table to get this working. If you have
   not set any languages in the DarkLangConfig table then the language selector will not be visible in the header.

name: FEATURES['SHOW_PROGRESS_BAR']
description_a: Set to True to show progress bar.

name: FEATURES['SKIP_EMAIL_VALIDATION']
description_a:
Turn this on to skip sending emails for user validation.
   Beware, as this leaves the door open to potential spam abuse.
warning_a: The login MFE domain name should be listed in LOGIN_REDIRECT_WHITELIST.

name: GLOBAL_NOTICE_ENABLED
description_a:
When enabled, show the contents of GLOBAL_NOTICE_MESSAGE
   as a message on every page. This is intended to be used as a way of
   communicating an upcoming or currently active maintenance window or to
   warn of known site issues. HTML is not supported for the message content,
   only plaintext. Message styling can be controlled with GLOBAL_NOTICE_TYPE,
   set to one of INFO, SUCCESS, WARNING, or ERROR (defaulting to INFO). Also
   see openedx.core.djangoapps.util.maintenance_banner.add_maintenance_banner
   for a variation that only shows a message on specific views.

name: HLSPlaybackEnabledFlag.enabled_for_all_courses
description_a: Add the "hls" profile to all displayed videos on the platform.

name: LOG_REQUEST_USER_CHANGES
description_a:
Turn this toggle on to provide additional debugging information in the case of a user
      verification error. It will track anytime the `user` attribute of a request object is changed and store this
      information on the request. This will also track the location where the change is coming from to quickly find
      issues. If user verification fails at response time, all of the information about these
      changes will be logged.
warning_a:
Adds some processing overhead to all requests to gather debug info. Will also double the logging
      for failed verification checks.

name: LOG_REQUEST_USER_CHANGE_HEADERS
description_a:
Turn this toggle on to log all request headers, for all requests, for all user ids involved in
      any user id change detected by safe sessions. The headers will provide additional debugging information. The
      headers will be logged for all requests up until LOG_REQUEST_USER_CHANGE_HEADERS_DURATION seconds after
      the time of the last mismatch. The header details will be encrypted, and only available with the private key.
warning_a:
Logging headers of subsequent requests following a mismatch will only work if
      LOG_REQUEST_USER_CHANGES is enabled and ENFORCE_SAFE_SESSIONS is disabled; otherwise, only headers of the inital
      mismatch will be logged. Also, SAFE_SESSIONS_DEBUG_PUBLIC_KEY must be set. See
      https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/master/common/djangoapps/util/log_sensitive.py
      for instructions.

name: MARK_LIBRARY_CONTENT_BLOCK_COMPLETE_ON_VIEW
description_a:
If enabled, the Library Content Block is marked as complete when users view it.
   Otherwise (by default), all children of this block must be completed.
warning_a:
For consistency in user-experience, keep the value in sync with the setting of the same name
   in the LMS and CMS.

name: ORGANIZATIONS_AUTOCREATE
description_a:
When enabled, creating a course run or content library with
   an "org slug" that does not map to an Organization in the database will trigger the
   creation of a new Organization, with its name and short_name set to said org slug.
   When disabled, creation of such content with an unknown org slug will instead
   result in a validation error.
   If you want the Organization table to be an authoritative information source in
   Studio, then disable this; however, if you want the table to just be a reflection of
   the orgs referenced in Studio content, then leave it enabled.

name: RATELIMIT_ENABLE
description_a:
When enabled, RATELIMIT_RATE is applied.
    When disabled, RATELIMIT_RATE is not applied.

name: SEARCH_SKIP_INVITATION_ONLY_FILTERING
description_a: If enabled, invitation-only courses will appear in search results.

name: SEARCH_SKIP_SHOW_IN_CATALOG_FILTERING
description_a:
If enabled, courses with a catalog_visibility set to "none" will still
    appear in search results.

name: SEND_CATALOG_INFO_SIGNAL
description_a:
When True, sends to catalog-info-changed signal when course_published occurs.
   This is a temporary toggle to allow us to test the event bus integration; it should be removed and
   always-on once the integration is well-tested and the error cases are handled. (This is separate
   from whether the event bus itself is configured; if this toggle is on but the event bus is not
   configured, we should expect a warning at most.)

name: SEND_EMAIL_ON_PROGRAM_COMPLETION
description_a: Toggle to control if we send a congratulatory email to learners after being issued a Program Certificate
warning_a: This is a toggle for the feature

name: SOME_FEATURE_NAME
description_a: Flag would be used to show account activation popup after the registration

name: USE_CERTIFICATE_AVAILABLE_DATE
description_a:
Toggle to control use of the certificate_available_date
   field during development.

name: USE_LEARNER_RECORD_MFE
description_a:
Determines if the Credentials IDA should redirect to the Learner Record MFE when navigating
   between the program detail page and program list pages.
warning_a:
Requires the Learner Record MFE to be deployed in a given environment if toggled to true. Requires
   a value to be set for the `LEARNER_RECORD_MFE_RECORDS_PAGE_URL` for navigation to route properly.

name: VEMPipelineIntegration.enabled
description_a:
Send videos to the Video Encode Manager (VEM) as part of the
      video pipeline.

name: VideoUploadsEnabledByDefault.enabled_for_all_courses
description_a:
Allow video uploads for all courses of the platform. This
      enables the "Video Uploads" menu in the CMS.

name: WIKI_ACCOUNT_HANDLING
description_a:
We recommend you leave this as 'False' for an Open edX installation
   to get the proper behavior for register, login and logout. For the original docs see:
   https://github.com/openedx/django-wiki/blob/edx_release/wiki/conf/settings.py

name: WIKI_ANONYMOUS
description_a:
Enabling this allows access to anonymous users.
   For the original docs, see:
   https://github.com/openedx/django-wiki/blob/edx_release/wiki/conf/settings.py
warning_a: Setting allow anonymous access to `True` may have styling issues.

name: WIKI_ENABLED
description_a:
This setting allows us to have a collaborative tool to contribute or
   modify content of course related materials.

name: WIKI_LINK_LIVE_LOOKUPS
description_a:
This setting is defined in the original docs:
   https://github.com/openedx/django-wiki/blob/edx_release/wiki/conf/settings.py

name: WIKI_USE_BOOTSTRAP_SELECT_WIDGET
description_a:
Enabling this will use the bootstrap select widget.
   For the original docs, see:
   https://github.com/openedx/django-wiki/blob/edx_release/wiki/conf/settings.py

name: account.redirect_to_microfrontend
note_s: Arch Team uses cases #1 (incremental rollout) and #5 (beta testing) for the new Account Settings implementation via micro-frontend., Arch Team uses cases #1 (incremental rollout) and #5 (beta testing) for the new Account Settings implementation via micro-frontend.
description_a:
Supports staged rollout of a new micro-frontend-based implementation of the account page.
   Its action can be overridden using site's ENABLE_ACCOUNT_MICROFRONTEND setting.
warning_a: Also set settings.ACCOUNT_MICROFRONTEND_URL.

name: agreements.enable_integrity_signature
note_s: MST-786: Used with frontend-app-learning to determine whether the honor code panel should be rendered for users that a) don't have an integrity signature yet and b) are attempting to access a graded unit.

name: block_structure.invalidate_cache_on_publish
description_a:
When enabled, the block structure cache is invalidated when changes to
   courses are published. If `block_structure.storage_backing_for_cache` is active, all block
   structures related to the published course are also cleared from storage.
warning_a: This switch will likely be deprecated and removed.

name: block_structure.prune_old_versions
note_s: EDUCATOR-499

name: block_structure.raise_error_when_not_found
description_a:
Raises an error if the requested block structure does not exist in block
   structure store, or if it is outdated. Block structure store refers to both cache and storage,
   if enabled.
warning_a:
This switch will likely be deprecated and removed.
   The annotation will be updated with the DEPR ticket once that process has started.

name: block_structure.storage_backing_for_cache
description_a:
When enabled, block structures are stored in a more permanent storage,
   like a database, which provides an additional backup for cache misses, instead having them
   regenerated. The regenration of block structures is a time consuming process. Therefore,
   enabling this switch is recommended for Production.
warning_a:
Depends on `BLOCK_STRUCTURES_SETTINGS['STORAGE_CLASS']` and
   `BLOCK_STRUCTURES_SETTINGS['STORAGE_KWARGS']`.
   This switch will likely be deprecated and removed.
   The annotation will be updated with the DEPR ticket once that process has started.

name: blockstore.use_blockstore_app_api
note_s:
This switch is per work called out in https://openedx.atlassian.net/browse/TNL-9776

It will be used to select whether the edx platform accesses the IDA version of blockstore or the Django App version. 

The enabled setting selects the Django App version., This switch is per work called out in https://openedx.atlassian.net/browse/TNL-9776

It will be used to select whether the edx platform accesses the IDA version of blockstore or the Django App version. 

The enabled setting selects the Django App version.
description_a:
Enable to use the installed blockstore app's Python API directly instead of the
   external blockstore service REST API.
   The blockstore REST API is used by default.
warning_a: This temporary feature toggle does not have a target removal date.

name: branding.enable_branding_logs
note_s: use the querystring: dwft_branding.enable_branding_logs=1

name: bulk_email.EMAIL_USE_COURSE_ID_FROM_FOR_BULK
description_a: If False, use the same BULK_EMAIL_DEFAULT_FROM_EMAIL or DEFAULT_FROM_EMAIL as the from_addr for all bulk email, to avoid issues with spam filtering

name: certificates.auto_certificate_generation
description_a: This toggle will enable certificates to be automatically generated

name: certificates.instructor_paced_only
note_s: EDUCATOR-528

name: certificates.self_paced_only
note_s: https://openedx.atlassian.net/browse/EDUCATOR-523

name: contentstore.bypass_olx_failure
note_s: infinity, this is an experimental flag for validating course olx during course import. Will be removed once the feature is live.
description_a: Enables bypassing olx validation failures during course import.

name: contentstore.course_import_olx_validation
note_s: Infinity, this is going to be replaced by a feature flag setting.

name: contentstore.individualize_anonymous_user_id
description_a: This flag enables the use of unique anonymous_user_id during studio preview

name: contentstore.library_authoring_mfe
description_a: Toggles the new micro-frontend-based implementation of the library authoring experience.
warning_a: Also set settings.LIBRARY_AUTHORING_MICROFRONTEND_URL and ENABLE_LIBRARY_AUTHORING_MICROFRONTEND.

name: contentstore.split_library_on_studio_dashboard
description_a: Enables data new view for library on studio dashboard.

name: course_apps.exams_ida
description_a: Uses exams IDA

name: course_apps.proctoring_settings_modal_view
description_a:
When enabled, users will be directed to a new proctoring settings
    modal on the Pages and Resources view when accessing proctored exam settings.
warning_a: None

name: course_blocks_api.hide_access_denials
description_a: Waffle flag to hide access denial messages in the course blocks.
warning_a: This temporary feature toggle does not have a target removal date.

name: course_duration_limits.enqueue_enabled
note_s:
Initial testing of Access Expiry Reminder emails

REVMI-95

name: course_experience.calendar_sync
description_a:
This course flag enables a course tool (which is a tool that is added on a course home page)
   that sends course assignment calendars to course students, whenever they click on the "Subscribe to calendar
   updates" button. The email contains an ics attachment that students can then use to sync with their own calendar
   apps.
warning_a: For this toggle to have an effect, the RELATIVE_DATES_FLAG toggle must be enabled, too.

name: course_experience.enable_about_sidebar_html
description_a: Used to determine whether to show custom HTML in the sidebar on the internal course about page.

name: course_experience.enable_course_goals
description_a: Used to determine whether or not to use course goals for the particular course.
warning_a: This temporary feature toggle does not have a target removal date.

name: course_experience.gdpr
note_s: GDPR deletion UI

name: course_experience.relative_dates
note_s:
Relative dates from edx-when and the new Dates tab.

Experiment being run by the Always Available Squad. Please leave this ticket in place for a while (maybe until early 2021), as we are waiting for all courses that started pre-experiment to end before dropping all waffle code.
description_a:
Waffle flag to enable relative dates for course content. A 'Dates' tab will be visible in the
   course view showing key course dates. Was previously an ExperimentWaffleFlag with experiment_id=17.
warning_a:
To set a relative due date for self-paced courses, the weeks_to_complete field for a course run
   needs to be set. Currently it can be set through the publisher app.

name: course_experience.relative_dates.1
note_s: Disables bucketing by forcing anyone in experiment, into the treatment bucket (we're in full rollout phase now)

name: course_experience.show_reviews_tool
note_s: Disabled this flag for all courses on 5/2.

name: course_experience.unified_course_tab
note_s:
As part of LEARNER-3605, this flag was set to No for everyone to match the old default of False, in advance of changing the default to True.  Ultimately, the intention is to get this to True and to remove this flag.
- Updated 4/11 to be on for superusers and members of the early content testing group.
-Updated 5/2 to be on for everyone.

name: course_experience.use_bootstrap
note_s: This flag is True by default, but this setting just makes it explicit.

name: course_list_api_rate_limit.rate_limit_10
description_a:
Waffle switch to enable the throttling of 10 requests/minute to the course API. For staff
   users, this limit is 20 requests/minute.

name: course_list_api_rate_limit.rate_limit_2
description_a:
Waffle switch to enable the throttling of 2 requests/minute to the course API. For staff
   users, this limit is 10 requests/minute.

name: course_live.enable_big_blue_button
description_a: Waffle flag to enable big blue button provider
warning_a: When the flag is ON, the big blue button provider will be available in course live

name: course_live.enable_course_live
description_a: Waffle flag to enable the course live app plugin
warning_a: When the flag is ON, the course live app will be visible in the course authoring mfe

name: course_modes.use_new_track_selection
description_a: This flag enables the use of the new track selection template for testing purposes before full rollout
warning_a: This temporary feature toggle does not have a target removal date.

name: courseware.enable_new_financial_assistance_flow
description_a: enables new internal only financial assistance flow, when active.

name: courseware.mfe_progress_milestones
note_s: This flag is owned by Engage squad. Mostly used to turn off the progress milestone feature for specific courses like capstones where it doesn't make sense. We need to figure out a longer-term solution for that problem.
description_a:
Waffle flag to display learner progress milestones in a course. Supports staged
   rollout to students for a new micro-frontend-based implementation of the courseware page.
warning_a: Also set settings.LEARNING_MICROFRONTEND_URL.

name: courseware.mfe_progress_milestones_streak_celebration
description_a:
Waffle flag to display a celebration modal when learner completes a configurable streak
   Supports staged rollout to students for a new micro-frontend-based implementation of the
   courseware page.
warning_a:
Also set settings.LEARNING_MICROFRONTEND_URL and
   COURSEWARE_MICROFRONTEND_PROGRESS_MILESTONES.

name: courseware.mfe_progress_milestones_streak_discount_enabled
description_a: This flag enables an engagement discount incentive message.
warning_a: This flag depends on the streak celebration feature being enabled

name: courseware.microfrontend_course_exit_page
note_s: Owned by Engage squad. Feature has landed, but flag is still around for course opt outs
description_a: Supports staged rollout of the new micro-frontend-based implementation of the course exit page.
warning_a: Also set settings.LEARNING_MICROFRONTEND_URL.

name: courseware.optimized_render_xblock
description_a:
Waffle flag that determines whether we speed up the render_xblock for browsers by
   removing unnecessary JavaScript and CSS. It is possible that this could introduce edge cases with content
   that relies on these assets, so being a CourseWaffleFlag will give us the flexibility to exempt courses
   from these optimizations.

name: credentials.student_records
note_s: A temporary feature toggle for the in-development Student Records work being done by the Learner <3 team, A temporary feature toggle for the in-development Student Records work being done by the Learner <3 team

name: credentials.use_learner_record_mfe
description_a:
This toggle will inform the Program Dashboard to route to the Learner Record MFE over the
     legacy frontend of the Credentials IDA.

name: discounts.enable_discounting
description_a: Toggle discounts always being disabled
warning_a: This temporary feature toggle does not have a target removal date.

name: discussions.enable_discussions_mfe
description_a: Waffle flag to use the new MFE experience for discussions in the course tab

name: discussions.enable_learners_stats
description_a: Waffle flag to enable learners stats
warning_a: When the flag is ON, API will return learners stats with original values.

name: discussions.enable_learners_tab_in_discussions_mfe
description_a: Waffle flag to enable learners tab in the new MFE experience for discussions

name: discussions.enable_moderation_reason_codes
description_a: Waffle flag to toggle support for the new edit and post close reason codes

name: discussions.enable_new_structure_discussions
description_a: Waffle flag to toggle on the new structure for in context discussions

name: discussions.enable_reported_content_email_notifications
note_s: Flag to enable/disable reported content email notifications for discussions.
description_a: Waffle flag to toggle email notifications for reported content for moderators

name: discussions.enable_view_mfe_in_iframe
note_s: Flag to enable new discussions MFE experience within an iframe, Flag to enable new discussions MFE experience within an iframe

name: discussions.override_discussion_legacy_settings
note_s:
(Multiple issues reported for discussion blackout dates - edx-infinity team)
A ticket came in which included many instances of the course where the course team has incorrectly set up course discussion blackout dates. In order to fix all those instances, course teams either have to update their blackout dates from the old UI or use course authoring MFE.

By enabling this waffle flag we are giving course teams an option to verify what they have entered and what were the instructions to add a new discussion blackout date. 

https://openedx.atlassian.net/browse/TNL-9374
description_a: Waffle flag to override visibility of discussion settings for legacy experience.
warning_a: When the flag is ON, the discussion settings will be available on legacy experience.

name: discussions.pages_and_resources_mfe
note_s:
infinity:  TNL-8846
Release v1.5
26th Oct 21

infinity/TNL-8443: New discussion experience.
Aug 17th 2021:
Disabled flag for staff / added infinity, marco, jfay, jristau
description_a: Waffle flag to enable new Pages and Resources experience for course.
warning_a: When the flag is ON, the new experience for Pages and Resources will be enabled.

name: edx_proctoring.rpnowv4_flow
note_s: When state is active, all RPNow proctored exams (i.e. those with backend null/"software_secure") will have a slightly altered learner flow. These flow changes are motivated by the fact that RPNow v4 doesn't cache its video to disk, and thus that we need to lock the learner out of their exam session if their connection to PSI's servers drop. The flow changes are such that the learner can only view their exam from within PSI's secure browser, which closes automatically in the network failure condition.

name: edx_search.default_elastic_search
note_s:
TNL-9899.
This switch will set the search to default to ElasticSearch when no search engine is found. This should be turned on before attempting to test OpenSearch., TNL-9899.
This switch will set the search to default to ElasticSearch when no search engine is found. This should be turned on before attempting to test OpenSearch.

name: effort_estimation.disabled
note_s: Flag created to match prod., Flag created to match prod., Turned off while we evaluate its future. Lots of courses could not be estimated due to missing video duraitons or offline components like bootcamps which we can't automatically measure. Engage Squad owns this feature.
description_a:
If effort estimations are confusing for a given course (e.g. the course team has added manual
   estimates), you can turn them off case by case here.

name: experiments.add_dashboard_info
description_a: Toggle for adding info about each course to the dashboard metadata
warning_a: This temporary feature toggle does not have a target removal date.

name: experiments.add_programs
description_a: Toggle for adding the current course's program information to user metadata
warning_a: This temporary feature toggle does not have a target removal date.

name: experiments.add_upsell_tracking
description_a: Make sure upsell tracking JS works as expected.
warning_a: This temporary feature toggle does not have a target removal date.

name: experiments.mobile_upsell_rev934
description_a: Toggle mobile upsell enabled
warning_a: This temporary feature toggle does not have a target removal date.

name: export_course_metadata
description_a: Export of course metadata (initially to s3 for use by braze)

name: grades.MATERIAL_RECOMPUTE_ONLY
note_s:
When this flag is on, only material changes in grading policy will trigger grade recalculation. Immaterial changes - that DON'T trigger recalculation anymore - are:
Assignment type Name changed
Abbreviation changed

name: grades.bulk_management
description_a:
When enabled, bulk features are visible for management in masters course. As far
   as we understand, this feature is now unused and obsolete.

name: grades.disable_regrade_on_policy_change
description_a: When enabled, a change in grading policy will not trigger re-grading.

name: grades.rejected_exam_overrides_grade
description_a:
When enabled, grades can no longer be updated 30 days after a course has ended. Note that this
   is only valid for courses which actually have an end date.

name: grades.writable_gradebook
description_a:
When enabled, add GET/POST endpoints for updating gradebook entries in bulk. Also, a link to
   the writable gradebook is added to the instructor dashboard.
warning_a: Enabling this requires that the `WRITABLE_GRADEBOOK_URL` setting be properly defined.

name: grades.write_only_if_engaged
note_s:
TNL-6904, TNL-6904
, EDUCATOR-258

name: instructor.enable_data_download_v2
description_a: instructor

name: instructor_task.generate_grade_report_for_verified_only
note_s:
Run grading tasks only for verified learners and skip audit/honor learners.
PROD-968
CR-3194

name: instructor_task.optimize_get_learners_for_course
note_s: EDUCATOR-3483: CS50 Grade Report memory usage

name: instructor_task.use_on_disk_grade_reporting
description_a: When generating grade reports, write chunks to disk to avoid out of memory errors.

name: ip.legacy
note_s: openedx.core.djangoapps.util.ip.USE_LEGACY_IP -- emergency/rollout switch to restore legacy IP determination. (Temporary switch.)
description_a:
Emergency switch to revert to use an older, less secure method for
   IP determination (instead of the newer, safer code in ``edx_django_utils.ip``).
   When enabled, instructs switch's callers to revert to using the *leftmost*
   IP from the X-Forwarded-For header. When disabled (the default), callers should use the new
   code path for IP determination, which has callers retrieve the entire external chain or pick
   the leftmost or rightmost IP from it. The construction of the external chain is configurable
   via ``CLOSEST_CLIENT_IP_FROM_HEADERS``.
     This toggle, as well as any other legacy IP references, should be deleted (in the off
   position) when the new IP code is well-tested and all IP-reliant code has been switched over
   to using ``edx_django_utils.ip``.
warning_a:
This switch does not globally control handling of IP addresses; it only
   affects code that is explicitly querying the switch and using ``get_legacy_ip``.

name: learner_dashboard.enable_masters_program_tab_view
description_a:
Waffle flag to enable new Masters Program discussion experience for masters program.
    This flag is used to decide weather we need to render master program data in "tab" view or simple view.
    In the new tab view, we have tabs like "journey", "live", "discussions"
warning_a: When the flag is ON, the new tabbed experience for Master Program Page will be enabled.

name: learner_dashboard.enable_program_tab_view
description_a:
Waffle flag to enable new Program discussion experience in tab view for course.
    This flag is used to decide weather we need to render program data in "tab" view or simple view.
    In the new tab view, we have tabs like "journey", "live", "discussions"
warning_a: When the flag is ON, the new experience for Program discussions will be enabled.

Flag for enabling ESG/ ORA Staff Grading experience.  Use to have rich on-platform grading for ORAs with a staff grading workflow

If the flag is enabled, course-specific authorization is
      required, and the course_id is either not provided or not authorized, the feature
      is not available.

description_a: Enable debug level of logging for schedules messages.

name: student.courseenrollment_admin
description_a: This toggle will enable the rendering of the admin view of the CourseEnrollment model.
warning_a:
Enabling this toggle may cause performance problems. The CourseEnrollment admin view
     makes DB queries that could cause site outages for a large enough Open edX installation.

warning_a: When the flag is ON, the teams app will be visible in the new course authoring mfe.

name: user_authn.enable_login_using_thirdparty_auth_only
description_a:
When enabled, users must be sign in using their allowed domain SSO account. This includes sign-
   ins to the Django admin dashboard at "/admin".
warning_a: Requires THIRD_PARTY_AUTH_ONLY_DOMAIN to also be set.

Description mentions staged rollout, but the use case is not set as temporary.
      This may actually be a temporary toggle.

Supports staged rollout to students for a new email templates

note_s: This flag decides whether to deprecate YT for edX videos hosting or not.

Waffle flag telling whether youtube is deprecated. When enabled, videos are no longer uploaded
   to YouTube as part of the video pipeline.

name: videos.enable_devstack_video_uploads
description_a:
When enabled, use Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for authenticating to AWS. These short-
   lived access tokens are well suited for development (probably?). [At the time of annotation, the exact consequences
   of enabling this feature toggle are uncertain.]
warning_a:
Enabling this feature requires that the ROLE_ARN, MFA_SERIAL_NUMBER, MFA_TOKEN settings are
   properly defined.
